title: 80/4. Necessity of ending the economic, commercial and financial embargo imposed by the United States of America against Cuba

paragraphs.1: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General on the implementation of resolution 79/7;1
paragraphs.2: Reiterates its call upon all States to refrain from promulgating and applying laws and measures of the kind referred to in the preamble to the present resolution, in conformity with their obligations under the Charter of the United Nations and international law, which, inter alia, reaffirm the freedom of trade and navigation;
paragraphs.3: Once again urges States that have and continue to apply such laws and measures to take the steps necessary to repeal or invalidate them as soon as possible in accordance with their legal regime;
paragraphs.4: Requests the Secretary-General, in consultation with the appropriate organs and agencies of the United Nations system, to prepare a report on the implementation of the present resolution in the light of the purposes and principles of the Charter and international law and to submit it to the General Assembly at its eighty-first session;
paragraphs.5: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eighty-first session the item entitled “Necessity of ending the economic, commercial and financial embargo imposed by the United States of America against Cuba”.
